head.title: KODAK APPOINTS PRESIDENT OF CONSUMER IMAGING

hedline.hl1: KODAK APPOINTS PRESIDENT OF CONSUMER IMAGING

abstract.p: Eastman Kodak Co names Daniel P Palumbo president of consumer imaging division, replacing Robert J Keegan; Matthias Freund is named chief operating officer of consumer imaging (S)

block.p: The Eastman Kodak Company named Daniel P. Palumbo, 42, president of its consumer imaging division. Mr. Palumbo, who joined Kodak from Procter & Gamble less than four years ago, had been the division's chief marketing officer, and worked for the last year on Internet-based photographic services. Mr. Palumbo replaces Robert J. Keegan, 53, who said only that he had accepted a position elsewhere. Kodak also named Matthias Freund, 52, chief operating officer of consumer imaging. Mr. Freund had been running Qualex, Kodak's wholesale photo-finishing subsidiary.

Mr. Freund had been running Qualex, Kodak's wholesale photo-finishing subsidiary.
